definition: to be obsessed with sth/to go overboard/(Buddhism, Taoism) to misguidedly focus on hallucinations that arise during meditation
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Still, this can be a maddening book.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，這可能是一本走火入魔的書。

sentences.english: I got a little carried away with the decorations.
sentences.chinese: 我對於裝潢有點走火入魔了。

sentences.english: Otherwise meaningless stunt too many special, things will be very deviated from the normal track.
sentences.chinese: 否則無意義的特技專場太多，就會顯得走火入魔。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
internal injury/disorder of internal organs (due to improper nutrition, overexertion etc)
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to go off accidentally/to catch fire
body and soul/physical and spiritual/material form and internal spirit
